sense.name: the termination, ending of a meeting
sense.commentary: ADJOURNMENT[+event][+social][+termination][+of_meeting] Note: implies the termination of a current meeting, it is completed.
sense.examples: John's motion for the adjournment of the meeting was seconded by Sally. The bill passed before the adjournment of Congress for the summer.

sense.name: the postponement of an activity
sense.commentary: ADJOURNMENT[+event][+social][+postponement][+of_activity] Note: implies a delay, that an activity may resume in the future
sense.examples: The judge has declared an adjournment of the trial until October. The whole department was frustrated upon hearing of the adjournment of the new project until funding came through.
